newsitem.title: USA: LCRA 400 MW Texas coal unit resumes full output.
newsitem.headline: LCRA 400 MW Texas coal unit resumes full output.

text.p: Lower Colorado River Authority (LCRA) said Thursday a 400 megawatt (MW) coal-fired unit at the Fayette Power Project resumed full output after it was scaled back Wednesday to repair a condenser pump.
Another of the complex's units, the 600 MW unit 1, was idled last weekend for seasonal maintenance. It is expected to return to operation by early December.
The adjoining Fayette unit 2, also rated at 600 MW, was operating at normal output, LCRA said.
The entire Fayette facility accounts for three-fourth of the utility's installed generating capacity.
Fayette units 1 and 2 are equally owned by LCRA and the city of Austin. Fayette unit 3 is wholly-owned by LCRA.
LCRA, headquartered in Austin, is a wholesale supplier of water and electricity in central and southern Texas.
